metadata.name: Hiding Files with Attrib.exe
metadata.comment: Detects usage of attrib.exe to hide files from users.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\attrib.exe')) AND lower(process.file.name) = lower('attrib.exe') AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' +h ')) AND NOT contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('\\desktop.ini ')) AND NOT (endswith(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower('\\cmd.exe')) AND lower(process.cmd_line) regexp '+r +h +s +a \\.*\.cui' AND lower(process.parent_process.cmd_line) regexp 'c:\\windows\\system32\\.*\.bat'))

output.summary: Detects usage of attrib.exe to hide files from users.

metadata.objective: False positives: 1. IgfxCUIService.exe hiding *.cui files via .bat script (attrib.exe a child of cmd.exe and igfxCUIService.exe is the parent of the cmd.exe) 2. Msiexec.exe hiding desktop.ini References: https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/unit42-sure-ill-take-new-combojack-malware-alters-clipboards-steal-cryptocurrency/, https://www.uptycs.com/blog/lolbins-are-no-laughing-matter
